answerText: South Island[10] This country's South Island-driven wine industry overtook its wool industry in exports in 2008. You can drink flat white here in Auckland or eat some kiwifruit, which was first commercially cultivated here.
heading: Penn Bowl |2014 | Packet 2 | 7 | Geography | None | College
subject: Geography
question: Question: This island contains Havelock, the greenshell mussel capital of the world. For 10 points each: [10] Name this island also home to the wine-producing Marlborough region. Other wine-producing regions on this island include the Central Otago region and the Canterbury Plains region near Christchurch.
